title: Creating true muonium via charmonium radiative decay
authors: Jian-Ping Dai, Hai-Bo Li, Shuai Zhao, Zong-Ying Zheng
abstract:
True muonium, the bound state of a muon and an antimuon ($\mu^+\mu^-$), has
long been theoretically predicted but remains experimentally elusive. We
investigate the production of true para-muonium in the radiative decay of
$J/\psi$ meson,and analyze the prospects for detecting true muonium in current
and future high-energy $e^+e^-$ experiments, particularly focusing on the
BESIII experiment and the proposed Super Tau-Charm Facility. Although the
events are rare at the super tau-charm facility, the detection of true
para-muonium via $J/\psi$ radiative decays could become feasible at its future
updates.
